u_shaped_ranking.context_window: across the OSPAR Maritime Area especially in biota. When compared to the Intermediate Assessment 2017 (OSPAR 2017) biota assessment, a change in the trend for the English Channel and Iberian Sea is seen. u_shaped_ranking.context_window: seen between the Intermediate Assessment 2017 and the current analysis for the two areas that are included in both assessments. The Northern North Sea goes from a significant decrease of > 5% per year to no significant decrease, and the Irish Sea goes from a significant decrease of > 10% per years to a significant decrease of < 10% per year. u_shaped_ranking.core_sentence: Our vision is a clean, healthy and biologically diverse North-East Atlantic
u_shaped_ranking.context_window: La reproduction de tout ou partie de ce rapport dans une publication peut être autorisée par l’Editeur, sous réserve que l’origine de l’extrait soit clairement mentionnée. Our vision is a clean, healthy and biologically diverse North-East Atlantic Ocean, which is productive, used sustainably and resilient to climate change and ocean acidification.

sentences.content: Key Message
Biota sites have good geographical coverage, sediment sites are more limited.
PBDEs in sediment and biota
have been stable (54% of assessed areas) or declining (46%) for the past 20 years.
Concentrations are below
Conclusion (brief)
PBDE concentrations are stable or declining across the OSPAR assessment area.
While the concentrations are
still above the BAC, they are, in general below the FEQG.
PBDE concentrations should therefore not cause
Conclusion (extended)
PBDE concentrations in both sediment and biota have in general been stable (54% of assessed areas) o...
declining (46% of assessed areas) across the OSPAR assessment area for the past 20 years.
Within the areas assessed, there is no reason to suspect general chronic effects on marine organisms...
concentrations are in general below the FEQG.
